articles.headline: Disinformation Researchers Raise Alarms About A.I. Chatbots
articles.snippet: Researchers used ChatGPT to produce clean, convincing text that repeated conspiracy theories and misleading narratives.
articles.abstract: Researchers used ChatGPT to produce clean, convincing text that repeated conspiracy theories and misleading narratives.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.
articles.byline: By Tiffany Hsu and Stuart A. Thompson

articles.headline: Biden Aims to Win Back White Working-Class Voters Through Their Wallets
articles.snippet: In his State of the Union address, the president signaled the opening of a yearslong push to persuade white working-class voters to return to the Democratic fold. Winning them over on cultural issues may be more difficult.
articles.abstract: In his State of the Union address, the president signaled the opening of a yearslong push to persuade white working-class voters to return to the Democratic fold. Winning them over on cultural issues may be more difficult.
articles.lead_paragraph: With his call for a “blue-collar blueprint to rebuild America,” President Biden on Tuesday night acknowledged rhetorically what Democrats have been preparing for two years: a fierce campaign to win back white working-class voters through the creation of hundreds of thousands of well-paid jobs that do not require a college degree.

articles.headline: Bing (Yes, Bing) Just Made Search Interesting Again
articles.snippet: Google has stiff competition now, after Microsoft integrated powerful A.I. technology into its search engine.
articles.abstract: Google has stiff competition now, after Microsoft integrated powerful A.I. technology into its search engine.
articles.lead_paragraph: Read the latest from Kevin Roose on his conversation with the chatbot built into Microsoft’s search engine.

articles.headline: Searching for Streaming Profit, Disney Cuts $5.5 Billion in Costs
articles.snippet: In the company’s first earnings report since Bob Iger returned as C.E.O., it exceeded Wall Street’s expectations. But about 7,000 jobs are expected to be cut.
articles.abstract: In the company’s first earnings report since Bob Iger returned as C.E.O., it exceeded Wall Street’s expectations. But about 7,000 jobs are expected to be cut.
articles.lead_paragraph: Robert A. Iger gave Disney’s corporate critics the equivalent of a punch in the mouth on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Millions Suffer Cold and Grief After Catastrophic Quake, Awaiting Help
articles.snippet: With thousands dead and many more left homeless in Turkey and Syria, people struggling to unearth victims, bury the dead and provide for millions of survivors are pleading for more aid.
articles.abstract: With thousands dead and many more left homeless in Turkey and Syria, people struggling to unearth victims, bury the dead and provide for millions of survivors are pleading for more aid.
articles.lead_paragraph: KAHRAMANMARAS, Turkey — The city’s soccer stadium is packed with tents to shelter families whose homes were destroyed in this week’s earthquakes. Outside, where people huddle in cars or around small fires to ward off the bitter cold, work crews struggle to extract the living and the dead from the ruins of apartment buildings that crumbled to the ground.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard, Safak Timur, Vivian Yee and Gulsin Harman

articles.headline: Steve Bannon’s Podcast Is Top Misinformation Spreader, Study Says
articles.snippet: A large podcast study found that Mr. Bannon’s “War Room” had more falsehoods and unsubstantiated claims than other political talk shows.
articles.abstract: A large podcast study found that Mr. Bannon’s “War Room” had more falsehoods and unsubstantiated claims than other political talk shows.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Stephen K. Bannon, the White House strategist turned podcaster, was explaining the latest Covid-19 developments in 2021, he passed the microphone to a special guest: Clay Clark, an evangelist and anti-vaccine activist.

articles.headline: When Having a Baby and Losing Your Job Collide
articles.snippet: At tech companies that spent recent years expanding paid parental leave, parents have felt the whiplash of mass layoffs in an especially visceral way.
articles.abstract: At tech companies that spent recent years expanding paid parental leave, parents have felt the whiplash of mass layoffs in an especially visceral way.
articles.lead_paragraph: Alex Gable spent recent weeks in the bleary-eyed haze of new parenthood. His son was born in November and Mr. Gable powered down his laptop, deleted Slack from his phone and focused on caring for his wife while making the most of the four precious hours a day that their baby was awake — there was tummy time and time spent ogling little drawings of snowflakes.
articles.byline: By Emma Goldberg and Tripp Mickle

articles.headline: U.S. Aims to Curtail Technology Investment in China
articles.snippet: The Biden administration is preparing new rules that would restrict U.S. dollars from flowing to China.
articles.abstract: The Biden administration is preparing new rules that would restrict U.S. dollars from flowing to China.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Growing concerns about China’s military and economic ambitions have lawmakers and the White House weighing yet another effort to restrict Beijing’s access to advanced technologies that could be used in war.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and Lauren Hirsch

articles.headline: Free Speech vs. Disinformation Comes to a Head
articles.snippet: The outcome of a case in federal court could help decide whether the First Amendment is a barrier to virtually any government efforts to stifle disinformation.
articles.abstract: The outcome of a case in federal court could help decide whether the First Amendment is a barrier to virtually any government efforts to stifle disinformation.
articles.lead_paragraph: In July 2021, as Covid-19 cases began to surge again, the surgeon general warned that misinformation had led to “avoidable illnesses and death” and urged the nation’s social media giants to do more to fight the sources of it.

articles.headline: ‘She Won’t Be Manageable’ They Said. Now She’s in Charge.
articles.snippet: Her father doubted her much of her career. Les Moonves launched a bid at CBS to overrule her. That was before sexual misconduct allegations came to light. Now Shari Redstone controls the media empire.
articles.abstract: Her father doubted her much of her career. Les Moonves launched a bid at CBS to overrule her. That was before sexual misconduct allegations came to light. Now Shari Redstone controls the media empire.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Sunday, May 13, 2018, Leslie Moonves, the chairman and chief executive of CBS, faced a difficult decision, perhaps the most agonizing of his long and celebrated media career: whether to pull the trigger on a coup against the Redstone family, which controlled CBS.
articles.byline: By James B. Stewart and Rachel Abrams

articles.headline: How Educators Secretly Remove Students With Disabilities From School
articles.snippet: Known as informal removals, the tactics are “off-the-book” suspensions often in violation of federal civil rights protections for those with disabilities.
articles.abstract: Known as informal removals, the tactics are “off-the-book” suspensions often in violation of federal civil rights protections for those with disabilities.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROSEBURG, Ore. — Jessica LaVigne was nervous but hopeful on a recent afternoon that the team managing her son’s special education plan at Roseburg High School would tell her something she had dreamed of for more than a decade: He would be able to attend a full day of school for the first time since second grade.

articles.headline: Chinese Balloon Had Tools to Collect Electronic Communications, U.S. Says
articles.snippet: China’s surveillance balloons have flown over more than 40 countries and are directed by the Chinese military, the State Department said. The F.B.I. is studying debris.
articles.abstract: China’s surveillance balloons have flown over more than 40 countries and are directed by the Chinese military, the State Department said. The F.B.I. is studying debris.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Biden administration provided its most comprehensive description of the Chinese spy balloon that traversed the United States last week, saying on Thursday that the machine was part of a global surveillance fleet directed by China’s military and was capable of collecting electronic communications.
articles.byline: By Edward Wong and Julian E. Barnes

articles.headline: Activist Disney Investor Ends Battle for Board Seat
articles.snippet: Nelson Peltz withdrew a day after Bob Iger, the chief executive, announced a restructuring that will cut $5.5 billion in costs and roughly 7,000 jobs.
articles.abstract: Nelson Peltz withdrew a day after Bob Iger, the chief executive, announced a restructuring that will cut $5.5 billion in costs and roughly 7,000 jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Behind the scenes at Disney on Thursday, senior executives were giddy. The activist investor Nelson Peltz, in a surprise morning phone call to CNBC, had ended his attempt to install himself or his son on Disney’s board and shake up the company.
articles.byline: By Brooks Barnes and Lauren Hirsch
